content.question:
<math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H liquid plus 3 O 2 gas react to produce 2 C O 2 gas plus 3 H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta S naught equals positive 217.7 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>217.7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught equals negative 1235 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1235</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

The combustion of <math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above and the standard entropy and enthalpy changes for the reaction are provided. When the reactants are combined at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, essentially no <math alttext="C O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced after a few hours. Which of the diagrams above could best help explain the low yield of the reaction under these conditions, and why?

choices.label: Diagram 1, because it represents a reaction that is not thermodynamically favorable with <math alttext="delta G naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, regardless of its reaction rate.
Diagram 1, because it represents a reaction that reaches equilibrium quickly after a very small amount of the reactants is consumed.

Diagram 2, because it represents a reaction with a high activation energy barrier for molecules to overcome and a very slow reaction rate, even if it is thermodynamically favorable with <math alttext="delta G naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Diagram 2, because it represents a reaction that is thermodynamically favorable with <math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, but the products formed are unstable and quickly revert to form reactants.

content.answer: Diagram 2, because it represents a reaction with a high activation energy barrier for molecules to overcome and a very slow reaction rate, even if it is thermodynamically favorable with <math alttext="delta G naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
